question.text: A beaker containing mixture of <math> <mrow>  <mtext>1</mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext>M</mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></math> and <math> <mrow>  <mtext>1</mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext>M</mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></math>. A gas <math><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> at <math><mn>1</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> is bubbled through this solution at <math><mtext>2</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>5</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> . If the reduction potential of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> , then

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> will oxidize  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and not  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>
<math><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> will oxidize  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> and not  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>
<math><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> will oxidize both  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>
<math><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>  will reduce both  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>

solution.text:
From the reduction potential, the tendency to gain electron is in the order Z>Y>X

Thus Y+e→Y - ; X→X++e .
